error.signature: ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement package>=2.0
error.regex: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement

verdict.summary: No version of the package matches the version constraint, or the package doesn't exist on PyPI.

dead_ends.action: Installing from a random third-party URL
dead_ends.why_fails: Supply chain risk; may install a malicious package
May install an incompatible old version

workarounds.action: Check PyPI for available versions: pip index versions <package>
workarounds.how: Lists all available versions; find one matching your constraint

workarounds.action: Verify the package name is correct â€” pip install is case-insensitive but some packages have unexpected names
workarounds.how: Example: Pillow not PIL, opencv-python not opencv

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Both produce similar messages, but 'could-not-find-version' and 'no-matching-distribution' differ in root cause and environment context.
